text: Proverbs
Prologue
Proverbs of Solomon, son of David, king of Israel:
To know wisdom and instruction,
to understand sayings of understanding,
to gain ⸤insightful instruction⸥,\f + \fr 1:3 \ft Literally “the instruction of insight” \f*
righteousness and justice and equity,
to give shrewdness\f + \fr 1:4 \ft Or “cleverness,” or “prudence” \f* to the simple,
knowledge and purpose\f + \fr 1:4 \ft Or “plan” \f* to the young,
may the wise hear and increase learning,
and the one who understands gain direction,\f + \fr 1:5 \ft Or “guidance” \f*
to understand a proverb and an expression,
words of wisdom and their riddles.
Fear of Yahweh \add is the\add* beginning of knowledge;
wisdom and instruction, fools despise.
Lecture Against Gang Behavior
My child, may you keep\f + \fr 1:8 \ft Or “obey,” or “hear” \f* your father’s instruction,
and do not reject your mother’s teachings,
for they \add are\add* a garland of favor for your head,
and pendants for your neck.
My child, if sinners entice you, do not consent.
If they say,
“Come with us!
We shall lie in wait for blood;
we shall ambush the innocent without cause.\f + \fr 1:11 \ft Or “wantonly,” or “for nothing” \f*
Like Sheol,\f + \fr 1:12 \ft A term for the place where the dead reside, i.e., the Underworld \f* we will swallow them alive
and whole, ⸤like those who descend to the pit⸥.\f + \fr 1:12 \ft Literally “like the descenders of a pit” \f*
We shall find all precious wealth,
we shall fill our houses \add with\add* booty,
you shall throw your lot in our midst,
there will be one purse for all of us.”
My child, do not walk in their way.\f + \fr 1:15 \ft Or “on their road” \f*
Keep your foot from their paths,
for their feet run to evil,
and they hurry to shed blood,
for “in vain\f + \fr 1:17 \ft Or “without cause,” or “for nothing” \f* is the net scattered,
in the sight of any ⸤winged bird⸥.”\f + \fr 1:17 \ft Literally “bird of wing” \f*
They lie in wait for their \add own\add* blood.
They ambush their \add own\add* lives.
Thus are the ways of all who are greedy \add for\add* gain—
it will take the life of its possessors.
The Call of Lady Wisdom
Wisdom calls out in the streets,
in the squares she raises her voice.
On a ⸤busy corner⸥\f + \fr 1:21 \ft Literally “head of commotion,” or “head of stirring, bustling” \f* she cries out,
at the entrances of the gates in the city, she speaks her sayings:
“⸤How long⸥,\f + \fr 1:22 \ft Literally “Until when” \f* O simple ones, will you love simplicity?
And \add how long\add* will scoffers delight in their scoffing,
and fools hate knowledge?
May you turn to my argument!\f + \fr 1:23 \ft Or “turn at my reproach” \f*
Behold, I shall pour out my spirit upon you;
I will make my words known to you.
Because I called out and you refused me,
I stretched out my hand, yet there is none who heeds.
You have ignored all my counsel,
and my reproof you are not willing \add to accept\add*.
I will also laugh at your calamity;\f + \fr 1:26 \ft Or “downfall” \f*
I will mock when panic\f + \fr 1:26 \ft Or “dread, fear” \f* comes \add upon\add* you.
When your panic comes like a storm,
and your calamity arrives like a whirlwind,
when distress and anguish come upon you,
then they will call\f + \fr 1:28 \ft Or “cry out \fq to \ft ” \f* me, but I will not answer;
they will seek me diligently but not find me.
Since they hated knowledge,
and did not choose the fear of Yahweh,
they were not willing \add to accept\add* my counsel,
they despised all my reproof.
They shall eat from the fruit of their way,
and they shall be sated from their own schemes,
for the waywardness of the simple ones will kill them,
and the complacency of fools will destroy them.
Whoever listens to me will dwell in security
and rest securely\f + \fr 1:33 \ft Or “be at ease, peace” \f* from dread and disaster.”
